v.generatedTitle: Searched GitHub repo for mcp-memory-service dashboard

v.value:
The mcp-memory-service has a Web Dashboard that runs on `http://localhost:8000`. It has 8 tabs: Dashboard, Search, Browse, Documents, Manage, Analytics, Quality, and API Docs. 

To start it, you run `memory server --http` which starts an HTTP server separate from the MCP server. But since we're using the Cloudflare backend (not local sqlite), and the MCP server is running via stdio, we'd need to start the HTTP dashboard separately.

Let me tell the user about this dashboard feature.

v.value:
Sim! O mcp-memory-service tem um **Web Dashboard** completo desde a v9.3.0. Ele roda em `http://localhost:8000` e tem **8 abas**:

| Aba | O que mostra |
|-----|-------------|
| **Dashboard** | Vis√£o geral (total de mem√≥rias, stats) |
| **Search** | Busca sem√¢ntica e por tags |
| **Browse** | Navegar/editar mem√≥rias |
| **Documents** | Upload e gest√£o de documentos |
| **Manage** | Gest√£o de mem√≥rias (delete, retag) |
| **Analytics** | Gr√°ficos de uso, trends, tags mais usadas |
| **Quality** | Score de qualidade das mem√≥rias |
| **API Docs** | Documenta√ß√£o da REST API |

### Como iniciar

O dashboard √© um **servidor HTTP separado** do servidor MCP (stdio). Para subir:

```bash
# Precisa das mesmas env vars do Cloudflare
memory server --http
```

Ou diretamente com Python:

```bash
python -m mcp_memory_service.server --http
```

Depois acessa `http://127.0.0.1:8000/`

**Importante**: Por padr√£o requer autentica√ß√£o. Para uso local, set `MCP_ALLOW_ANONYMOUS_ACCESS=true`

# MCP Memory Service
...
## Stop Re-Explaining Your Project to AI Every Session
...
Your AI assistant forgets everything when you start a new chat. After 50 tool
uses, context explodes to 500k+ tokens‚ÄîClaude slows down, you restart, and now it
remembers nothing. You spend 10 minutes re-explaining your architecture. Again.


MCP Memory Service solves this.


It automatically captures your project context, architecture decisions, and code
patterns. When you start fresh sessions, your AI already knows everything‚Äîno
re-explaining, no context loss, no wasted time.

All SHODH implementations share the same memory schema:


‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Emotional Metadata: `emotion`, `emotional_valence`, `emotional_arousal`
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Episodic Memory: `episode_id`, `sequence_number`, `preceding_memory_id`
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Source Tracking: `source_type`, `credibility`
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Quality Scoring: `quality_score`, `access_count`, `last_accessed_at`


Interoperability Example: Export memories from mcp-memory-service ‚Üí Import to shodh-cloudflare ‚Üí Sync
across devices ‚Üí Full fidelity preservation of emotional_valence, episode_id, and
all spec fields.

## Migration to v9.0.0

Permalink: Migration to v9.0.0
‚ö° TL;DR: No manual migration needed - upgrades happen automatically!


Breaking Changes:


‚Ä¢ Memory Type Ontology: Legacy types auto-migrate to new taxonomy (task‚Üíobservation, note‚Üíobservation)
‚Ä¢ Asymmetric Relationships: Directed edges only (no longer bidirectional)


Migration Process:


1. Stop your MCP server
2. Update to latest version (`git pull` or `pip install --upgrade mcp-memory-service`)
3. Restart server - automatic migrations run on startup:
  ‚ó¶ Database schema migrations (009, 010)
  ‚ó¶ Memory type soft-validation (legacy types ‚Üí observation)
  ‚ó¶ No tag migration needed (backward compatible)


Safety: Migrations are idempotent and safe to re-run

### üçé macOS SQLite Extension Support

Permalink: üçé macOS SQLite Extension Support
macOS users may encounter `enable_load_extension` errors with sqlite-vec:


‚Ä¢ System Python on macOS lacks SQLite extension support by default
‚Ä¢ Solution: Use Homebrew Python: `brew install python && rehash`
‚Ä¢ Alternative: Use pyenv: `PYTHON_CONFIGURE_OPTS='--enable-loadable-sqlite-extensions' pyenv install 3.12.0`
‚Ä¢ Fallback: Use Cloudflare or Hybrid backend: `--storage-backend cloudflare` or `--storage-backend hybrid`
‚Ä¢ See [Troubleshooting Guide](https://github.com/doobidoo/mcp-memory-service/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting/general.md#macos-sqlite-extension-issues) for details

Permalink: ‚ö†Ô∏è First-Time Setup Expectations
On your first run, you'll see some warnings that are completely normal:


‚Ä¢ "WARNING: Failed to load from cache: No snapshots directory" - The service is checking for cached models (first-time setup)
‚Ä¢ "WARNING: Using TRANSFORMERS_CACHE is deprecated" - Informational warning, doesn't affect functionality
‚Ä¢ Model download in progress - The service automatically downloads a ~25MB embedding model (takes 1-2
minutes)


These warnings disappear after the first successful run. The service is working
correctly! For details, see our [First-Time Setup Guide](https://github.com/doobidoo/mcp-memory-service/blob/main/docs/first-time-setup.md).

Hybrid Search (v10.8.0+):

  # Enable hybrid BM25 + vector search (default: enabled)
export MCP_HYBRID_SEARCH_ENABLED=true

# Configure score fusion weights (must sum to ~1.0)
export MCP_HYBRID_KEYWORD_WEIGHT=0.3    # BM25 keyword match weight
export MCP_HYBRID_SEMANTIC_WEIGHT=0.7   # Vector similarity weight

# Adjust weights based on your use case:
# - More keyword-focused: 0.5 keyword / 0.5 semantic
# - More semantic-focused: 0.2 keyword / 0.8 semantic
...

...
# - Default balanced: 0.3 keyword / 0.7 semantic (recommended)> 


Note: Hybrid search is only available with `sqlite_vec` and `hybrid` backends. It automatically combines BM25 keyword matching with vector
similarity for better exact match scoring while maintaining semantic capabilities.

 
### Response Size Management üÜï v9.0.0

Permalink: Response Size Management üÜï v9.0.0
Control maximum response size to prevent context overflow:

  # Limit response size (recommended: 30000-50000)
export MCP_MAX_RESPONSE_CHARS=50000  # Default: unlimited
Applies to all retrieval tools:


‚Ä¢ `retrieve_memory`, `recall_memory`, `retrieve_with_quality_boost`
‚Ä¢ `search_by_tag`, `recall_by_timeframe`


Behavior:


‚Ä¢ Truncates at memory boundaries (preserves data integrity)
‚Ä¢ Recommended: 30000-50000 characters for optimal context usage

### Workflow: Clean Up Untagged Memories

### Dashboard Memory Edit

Permalink: Dashboard Memory Edit
Open [http://127.0.0.1:8000](http://127.0.0.1:8000/)


To edit a single memory:


1. Find memory (search or filter)
2. Click to view details
3. Click "Edit Memory"
4. Modify tags (comma-separated)
5. Click "Update Memory"


Example:

  
```
Before: "needs-categorization"
After:  "release, v8.64, bug-fix, sync"

### Preventing Future Cleanup Issues

Permalink: Preventing Future Cleanup Issues
Version 8.64.0+:


‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Soft-delete with tombstone support (v8.64.0)
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Bidirectional sync race condition fix (v8.64.0)
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Cloudflare hybrid sync validation (v8.64.1)


Best practices:


1. Use meaningful tags from the start
2. Review untagged memories regularly
3. Run cleanup scripts after major changes
4. Verify tags in Dashboard before deletion

Sim! O mcp-memory-service tem um **Web Dashboard** completo desde a v9.3.0. Ele roda em `http://localhost:8000` e tem **8 abas**:

| Aba | O que mostra |
|-----|-------------|
| **Dashboard** | Vis√£o geral (total de mem√≥rias, stats) |
| **Search** | Busca sem√¢ntica e por tags |
| **Browse** | Navegar/editar mem√≥rias |
| **Documents** | Upload e gest√£o de documentos |
| **Manage** | Gest√£o de mem√≥rias (delete, retag) |
| **Analytics** | Gr√°ficos de uso, trends, tags mais usadas |
| **Quality** | Score de qualidade das mem√≥rias |
| **API Docs** | Documenta√ß√£o da REST API |

### Como iniciar

O dashboard √© um **servidor HTTP separado** do servidor MCP (stdio). Para subir:

```bash
# Precisa das mesmas env vars do Cloudflare
memory server --http
```

Ou diretamente com Python:

```bash
python -m mcp_memory_service.server --http
```

Depois acessa `http://127.0.0.1:8000/`

**Importante**: Por padr√£o requer autentica√ß√£o. Para uso local, set `MCP_ALLOW_ANONYMOUS_ACCESS=true` ou defina `MCP_API_KEY`.

toolCalls.arguments:
{"content": "#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Start MCP Memory Dashboard
# Inicia o servidor HTTP do mcp-memory-service com o dashboard web.
# Acesso: http://localhost:8000
#
# Uso: ./start-memory-dashboard.sh [--port 8000] [--no-browser]

set -e

PORT=8000
OPEN_BROWSER=true
CONFIG_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "$0")" && pwd)"
CRED_FILE="$CONFIG_DIR/credentials.yml"

# --- Parse args ---
while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    case $1 in
        --port) PORT="$2"; shift 2 ;;
        --no-browser) OPEN_BROWSER=false; shift ;;
        *) echo "‚ùå Op√ß√£o desconhecida: $1"; exit 1 ;;
    esac
done

# --- Carregar credenciais ---
if [ ! -f "$CRED_FILE" ]; then
    echo "‚ùå credentials.yml n√£o encontrado em $CONFIG_DIR"
    exit 1
fi

parse_yaml_value() {
    grep "$1" "$CRED_FILE" | head -1 | sed 's/.*"\(.*\)"/\1/'
}

ACCOUNT_ID=$(parse_yaml_value "account_id")
API_TOKEN=$(parse_yaml_value "api_token")
VECTORIZE_INDEX=$(parse_yaml_value "vectorize_index")
D1_DATABASE_ID=$(parse_yaml_value "d1_database_id")
STORAGE_BACKEND=$(parse_yaml_value "storage_backend")
STORAGE_BACKEND=${STORAGE_BACKEND:-cloudflare}

if [ -z "$ACCOUNT_ID" ] || [ -z "$API_TOKEN" ]; then
    echo "‚ùå Credenciais Cloudflare incompletas no credentials.yml"
    exit 1
fi

# --- Detectar Python ---
PYTHON=""
if command -v python3 &>/dev/null; then
    PYTHON="python3"
elif command -v python &>/dev/null; then
    PYTHON="python"
fi

if [ -z "$PYTHON" ]; then
    echo "‚ùå Python n√£o encontrado. Instale Python 3.12+"
    exit 1
fi

echo "üìä MCP Memory Dashboard"
echo "   Python:  $PYTHON"
echo "   Backend: $STORAGE_BACKEND"
echo "   URL:     http://localhost:$PORT"
echo ""

# --- Exportar vari√°veis de ambiente ---
export MCP_MEMORY_STORAGE_BACKEND="$STORAGE_BACKEND"
export CLOUDFLARE_ACCOUNT_ID="$ACCOUNT_ID"
export CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN="$API_TOKEN"
export CLOUDFLARE_VECTORIZE_INDEX="$VECTORIZE_INDEX"
export CLOUDFLARE_D1_DATABASE_ID="$D1_DATABASE_ID"
export MCP_HTTP_PORT="$PORT"
export MCP_ALLOW_ANONYMOUS_ACCESS="true"

# --- Abrir browser automaticamente ---
if [ "$OPEN_BROWSER" = true ]; then
    (sleep 5 && {
        if command -v xdg-open &>/dev/null; then
            xdg-open "http://localhost:$PORT"
        elif command -v open &>/dev/null; then
            open "http://localhost:$PORT"
        fi
    }) &
    echo "üåê Browser abrir√° automaticamente em 5s..."
fi

echo "üöÄ Iniciando servidor... (Ctrl+C para parar)"
echo ""

# --- Iniciar servidor HTTP ---
if command -v memory &>/dev/null; then
    memory server --http --storage-backend "$STORAGE_BACKEND"
else
    $PYTHON -m mcp_memory_service.cli server --http --storage-backend "$STORAGE_BACKEND"
fi
